greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the number of compositions of n with cuts-resistance k.
comment: A composition of n is a finite sequence of positive integers summing to n.
For the operation of shortening all runs by 1, cuts-resistance is defined as the number of applications required to reach an empty word.
example: Row n = 6 counts the following compositions (empty columns not shown):
xref: Row sums without the k = 1 column are A261983.
The version for runs-resistance is A329744.
The version for binary vectors is A329860.
The cuts-resistance of the binary expansion of n is A319416.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Nov 23 2019
